intro: Stauropsis alpina, commonly known as the alpine stauropsis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Due to its delicate structure, it is adapted to withstand harsh mountain conditions and is a symbol of high-altitude biodiversity.
